info.name: EduGeek Forums All Dark
info.description: Makes EduGeek Forums a bit darker and easier on the eye.
info.additionalInfo:
To install this theme you with need Osprey for Chrome or StylRRR for Firefox:

Osprey:  https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/osprey/ekjapccimkannnfgcnnoajhfdglobgak?hl=en
SytlRRR: https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/stylrrr/

The quickest way to use this style with Osprey is to install the extension onto Chrome then go to Edugeek.net. Once you are there click the extension icon at the top right and choose "Find more styles for this site." this will take you to the style page and press "Install Style".

StylRRR is a little more difficult to install styles for (or at least I can find a quick way). On this page you should be able to see "Show CSS" when you scroll down, open that and copy the code. Once you have the code on your clipboard, open Firefox and click the StylRRR extension. Click new style and fill in the top three boxes, the first two can be anything but the URL box should have "edugeek.net". Once done, press "Save" and then go to Edit Styles. When you are here press "Reload from disk" then open the drop down menu and choose the style that you just named earlier, and paste the CSS code into there and press "Save" this should apply the style to that webpage. To update you will just have to check the CSS on this page and paste in there once I have released updates.
